column1: Baruk Khazâd! Khazâd ai-mênu! was a Khuzdul battlecry.
==History==
Though the battle-cry was much older
column2: the first recorded use was in the Battle of the Hornburg:

column1: But a Gimli that none had observed sprang out of the shadows and gave a hoarse shout: Baruk Khazâd! Khazâd ai-mênu! An axe swung and swept back. Two Orcs fell headless. The rest fled.J.R.R. Tolkien
Later
column2: Gimli gave some variations on the battle-cry: Khazâd! Khazâd! and Khazâd ai-mênu!.

column1: ==Etymology==
The cry is translated "Axes of the Dwarves! The Dwarves are upon you!".J.R.R. Tolkien
